person.persName: Charles Colcock Jones Jr. (Chatham County, Georgia, student, attorney, mayor of Savannah, first lieutenant and lieutenant colonel (C.S.A))

body.p: Chatham County, Georgia, student, attorney, mayor, and soldier. Savannah, Georgia native. Son of Charles Colcock Jones Sr. and Mary Jones. Married to Ruth Berrien Whitehead Jones in Richmond County, Georgia, on November 9, 1858. Father of Julia B. Jones and Ruth Berrien Jones. Married to Eva Berrien Eve Jones in Richmond County on October 28, 1863. Father of Edworth Jones. Attended South Carolina College in Columbia, South Carolina. Graduate of the College of New Jersey in Princeton, New Jersey, in 1852. Graduate of Harvard University in Cambridge, Massachusetts, in 1855. Resident of Liberty County, Georgia, in 1850. Household owned eighty-five enslaved persons in Liberty County in 1850. Attorney in Chatham County in 1859. Attorney in Chatham County in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Chatham County in 1860. Mayor of Savannah in 1860. Served in the Chatham Artillery (C.S.A.) as first lieutenant and lieutenant colonel from 1861 to 1863.
